channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024090554
item.description:
Report E-2024090554

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T00:42:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight notified ERTS of a cargo release which resulted in approximately (1) Gallon of ICA Coating released from 5-Gallon metal pail due to skid puncture from the shipper. The release impacted the trailer but no storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used one (1) twenty-five (25) Gallon poly drum for the waste and oil dri for the absorbent used to clean area affected.

item.title: Report E-2024100718
item.description:
Report E-2024100718

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of Toro Oven & Grill Cleaner released from one (1) one (1) gallon plastic jug due to improperly stacked freight. The release impacted the trailer floor. Personnel stated they cleaned up the spill and generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum of waste containing the damaged gallon jug partially full of product, along with some impacted cardboard. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100477
item.description:
Report E-2024100477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of UN1263 Valspar Gray Backer released from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon metal drum due to a puncture caused by an unknown object on the trailer floor. Personnel advised the release impacted the floor of trailer. Dayton Freight confirmed they cleaned the release with Oil Dri absorbent and over packed the punctured drum. Personnel generated one (1) 85-gallon poly drum containing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum of product and one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum containing spent absorbents. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100377
item.description:
Report E-2024100377

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of product released from one (1) metal pail due to improper loading. The personnel advised the release impacted inside of trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the spill using Oil Dri absorbent. The personnel advised they generated one (1) three (3) gallon poly drum containing spent absorbents and spilled product, along with one (1) ten (10) gallon metal pail containing punctured pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100369
item.description:
Report E-2024100369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifty-five (55) gallons of NA 1993 Stoddard solvent released from one (1) metal drum due to improper loading. They advised the release impacted the inside of the trailer floor, and that they cleaned spill with Oil Dri absorbent. Dayton Freight personnel generated one (1) sixty-five (65) gallon poly drum of waste containing spent absorbents, PPE, and the damage drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100333
item.description:
Report E-2024100333

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-14
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of product released from one (1) metal pail due to getting crushed in transit. The release impacted inside of the trailer floor of trailer #506641. Dayton freight personnel cleaned up the spill using oil dri. Personnel advised they generated one (1) ten (10) gallon metal drum containing punctured drum. The team also generated one (1) five (5) gallon metal drum containing spent absorbents. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of Sher-Wood Kemvar 5411S Wood Surfacer released from one (1) five (5) gallon metal pail. The release impacted the trailer floor of trailer #511196. Personnel advised they cleaned spill using oil dri. Dayton Freight personnel advised they generated one (1) ten (10) gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100707
item.description:
Report E-2024100707

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-18
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 16, 2024, six (6) 1-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. ISR personnel solidified the damaged pails. All spent absorbents and the damaged pails were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024101666
item.description:
Report X-2024101666

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-24
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Oct 23rd a package was discovered leaking after falling out of the ULD. The package contained two inner containers of UN3265, Corrosive liquid, acidic, organic, n.o.s., 8, II. One of the bottles had their lid popped off and the entire contents leaked out. The package was put into a steel salvage drum and is being sent for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY A NIGHT SUPERVISOR AND BROUGHT TO CAGE. RESPONDER ASSESSED THE PACKAGE NOTING WET AREAS ON THE EXTERIOR OF THE BOX. UPON OPENING THE PACKAGE THE CONTENTS WERE LEAKING FROM THE LID. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND OPERATORS QUICK REFERENCE GUIDE TO PROCESS THE CONTENTS.

item.title: Report E-2024100660
item.description:
Report E-2024100660

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T00:48:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-04
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Love's Travel Stops & Country Stores
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 100-gallons of diesel fuel was released impacting a 75' X 150' area of asphalt and concrete due to UST overflow during loading. It was reported no drains or waterways were impacted. HEPACO utilized a sweeper, absorbents, and a drum-vac to collect and containerize the free standing liquid. HEPACO completed clean up and generated 4, 55-gallon metal drums of diesel fuel and spent absorbents.

item.title: Report E-2024100673
item.description:
Report E-2024100673

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver went to leave the facility after being loaded he noticed liquid dripping from the trailer. This facility has an emergency response team located on sight and they put down absorbents and then began unloading trailer. They found that the drum had been damaged when loading by the pallet that was placed next to it. The crew repacked the drum into a salvage drum and all absorbents used to clean up the material that was released was also disposed of properly. The trailer was then reloaded and set on there way. The event only took about an hour to complete.
